result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador R Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 58 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.

Domestic Counseling or Anger Mangement and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint, their residences or anywhere the victims are at.
No violent contact with K.K. (girlfriend) and only with her permission.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
AMENDED 11-12-2015:  Restitution has been moved to defendant's Case 15CM1863.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) - with all standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.

Letter dated 8/16/16 filed by defendant requesting sentence credit.

Response letter from court to defendant regarding his request for a current assessment report (defendant was advised to contact the Department of Corrections).
Inmate communicationi form filed by defendant regarding sentence credit and his release from custody.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with attached copies of Judgment of Conviction, requesting they be amended and corrected to show restitution owing on 15CM1494, not on case 15CM1863.

filed by defendant requesting his huber privileges be reinstated.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Salvador R Hernandez in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Victim E.Z. presented statements to the court.




Court orders the following:
6 Months the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
58 Days Credit.
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
DV Counseling or Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims listed in the criminal complaint, their residences or anywhere the victims are at.
No Violent Contact with:  Victim K.K. (girlfriend) and only with her permission.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Health Evaluation and Follow Through.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to be transferred to the Huber Facility - FORTHWITH.
